tweets.content:
Quick Guide: How to Systematically Solve Your Revenge Trading Problem INSTANTLY

First, understand this:
Trading IS drug addiction.
Worse, even â€” because society celebrates yours.

Let me explain:
You overdose on heroin â†’ people tell you to get help.
You blow up your account â†’ people say:

â€œJust go SMALLER size to get your market feel back!â€

SMALLER SIZE?
Thatâ€™s not discipline. Thatâ€™s enabling a relapse.
Howâ€™s that ANY different from a friend saying,

â€œJust one SMALLER hit and youâ€™ll be fine,â€ right after you got out of rehab?

1. Why is it like drug addiction?

Addicts always say theyâ€™ll stop after a bad trip.
Traders always say theyâ€™ll stop revenge trading after a bad loss.

Then 2 hours later,
youâ€™re curled up on your sofa, shorting $ETH, thinking:

â€œJust one last trade. Iâ€™ll make it back, I swear.â€

Youâ€™re in pain.
And impulsive trading IS your freaking morphine.

The WORST part?
Everyone claps.

You lose it all â†’ they call you â€œambitious.â€
You spiral â†’ they say youâ€™re â€œmanaging volatility.â€
Youâ€™re gambling, coping, rotting â†’ they call it â€œconviction.â€

2. Whatâ€™s going on in your mind?

You think:

â€œIf I held longer, Iâ€™d have bought a house.â€
It crashes.
â€œIf I hold longer, itâ€™ll bounce.â€
It bleeds.
â€œI sold too early. Next time, Iâ€™ll just hold.â€
And the cycle repeats.

The core addiction loop:
Anticipation â†’ Trigger â†’ Action â†’ Regret â†’ Vow â†’ Relapse.
Same as drugs. Just with charts.

3. So how do you FIX it, systematically?

You use the same PROVEN system addicts use to get clean.

Itâ€™s called the 12 Steps â€”
Used by the worldâ€™s largest addiction recovery groups: Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), Narcotics Anonymous (NA), and Cocaine Anonymous (CA).

Theyâ€™ve helped millions worldwide break free from compulsive self-destruction.

Not with inspirational talks.
But with a dead-simple, brutally effective framework that works when your brain doesnâ€™t.

Start with Step 1 and Step 2.
That alone will stop 80% of your worst trading spirals.

STEP 1: Admit you are powerless over your bad decisions/addiction

This isnâ€™t some spiritual fluff.
Itâ€™s executive function collapse. 
Your prefrontal cortex shuts down, and your limbic brain takes over.

You know itâ€™s a bad trade, but youâ€™re not in control.
Youâ€™re running survival scripts, not strategy.

You long. It dumps.
You DCA. You MOVE the stop-loss.
You WON'T CLOSE THE TRADE because your ego says:

â€œCutting = Admitting Failure = Death.â€

Thatâ€™s ego death aversion.
Same reason addicts say:

â€œIâ€™ve got this under control.â€
Spoiler: you donâ€™t.

STEP 2: Accept that logic wonâ€™t save you and only a Higher Power can restore your sanity.

You think you can ANALYZE your way out of FEAR.
You canâ€™t.

This isnâ€™t about being smart.
Itâ€™s about surrender.

- You need a higher power. Not God, necessarily.

- You need to surrender to a framework that acts on your behalf when youâ€™re not capable.

- You need to build one set of strategy and STICK TO IT for a while (at least months-long timeframe). No switching. No tweaking mid-trade.

- Then set hard-coded rules with punishments THAT HURT.

- FOR EXAMPLE: break a rule, send your friend 10k, or do 50 pushups, or post on Twitter: â€œIâ€™m a dumbass who revenge trades.â€

These are just 2 out of 12 steps. But internalizing even these two kills 80% of your worst trades.

-----------------------

4. WHY IT WORKS?âš ï¸
Because long-term recovery IS NOT ABOUT WILLPOWER.
Itâ€™s about maintenance of awareness.

Whatâ€™s the difference between an addict who relapses after 3 months and one who stays clean for 30+ years?

The 30-year survivor says every day:
â€œI have a disease that will never be cured. I can only manage it.â€

The one who relapses says:
â€œIâ€™m fine now. Iâ€™ve recovered.â€

Same with trading.
The moment you think youâ€™ve â€œmastered it,â€
Youâ€™ve already started losing.

Society tells traders:
â€œYouâ€™re a genius. Youâ€™re a killer. Youâ€™re ambitious.â€

No.
Youâ€™re just high.
GN and get help.

tweets.content:
Why The Best Losers Win

Been trading more forex and indices lately than crypto.
Came across a book called Best Loser Wins by @TomHougaard, and itâ€™s hands down one of the most brutally honest trading books Iâ€™ve read.

Wanted to share a few killer insights that I think every serious trader needs to hear.

The Big Idea:
What if the very instincts that make you a decent human are what destroy you as a trader?

You donâ€™t actually make BAD decisions, you just make PAINFUL ones go away.

Thatâ€™s the real root of failure:
- You cut winners because uncertainty feels unbearable.

- You hold losers because realizing the loss hurts more than being wrong.

- You ditch your plan the moment price pulls back 0.2%.

Thatâ€™s your nervous system protecting itself.
Your brain evolved to survive physical threats (like lions), not trade charts.

Financial loss lights up the SAME neural circuitry as physical pain.

So when you hold a trade and it goes slightly against you, it literally HURTS.
Your brain reacts like a caveman touching fire:
Pull away. Escape. Now.

So youâ€™re basically running prehistoric software in a modern game.

1. Best losers win. Because they turn pain into precision.

A losing trade is only a problem if you learn nothing.
- Traders fear losses because they donâ€™t review them.
- But the edge is born from post-trade review.

Your brain is wired to FORGET pain.
You have to FORCE it to remember, review, and learn â€” or repeat the same dumb mistakes forever.

2. Practice doesnâ€™t make perfect, it makes permanent.

10,000 hours doesnâ€™t matter if itâ€™s passive repetition.
So instead of training habits, train SPECIFIC MENTAL TASKS instead.

Example:
â€¢ Study every fake breakout on $ETH this year.
â€¢ Tag every trade you exited early.
â€¢ Ask: Why did I break plan? What emotion triggered it?

Thatâ€™s where rewiring starts.

3. Do the â€œfeels wrongâ€ thing: Add to winners, not losers.

90% of retail adds to losers because it feels smart, safe, and human.

But pros like Richard Dennis, the guy who turned $1.6k into $200M, do the opposite:
- They add to winners, not losers.
- They scale into strength, not hope.

So who do you trust?
Your emotional lizard brain, or one of the greatest traders in history?

4. The â€œBook of Horrorâ€
Log your worst trades.
TORTURE yourself with them daily until you feel NOTHING. No emotions, only data.

Like Alex Honnold on this cliff: laser-focused, emotionless, with fear long gone and only precision left.
Thatâ€™s how you build mental scar tissue â€” the kind that protects capital.

Visited a church where the walls are made of real human bones.

Thought Iâ€™d fear but felt the greatest peace in my life.

Weâ€™re always trying to stop our â€œemotional issues,â€ â€œoverthinking,â€ â€œimpulsiveness.â€

But thatâ€™s like saying, â€œdonâ€™t think of an elephant.â€ The more you tell yourself to ignore it, the louder it gets.

Donâ€™t push it away.
Welcome it. Accept it. Let it sit beside you.

It feels almost against human nature.
But the moment you love the part of you youâ€™ve been trying to kill,
it stops fighting for your attention.

Like this church of bones.
The fear was still there,
it just didnâ€™t own me anymore.

1. The Constitutional Monarchy Paradox:

Vitalikâ€™s role mirrors Louis XIVâ€™s infamous â€œLâ€™Ã‰tat, câ€™est moiâ€ (I am the state).

His intellectual authority stifles dissent, even if unintentionally.

This exemplifies Michel Foucaultâ€™s theory of power/knowledge: â€œTrue dominance lies not in coercion, but in controlling what is accepted as truth.â€

â€¢ The French Revolution didnâ€™t just overthrow a king, it shattered the idea of monarchy itself.

â€¢ Ethereum needs its own revolution: not a fork, but a social reset where authority flows from code, not charisma.

â€¢ Bitcoin, in contrast, functions as a stateless anarcho-republic.

â€¢ Satoshiâ€™s disappearance forced the community to adopt emergent governance: Disputes â€” like the blocksize wars â€” resolve not through ideology, but economic consensus.

â€¢ Ethereumâ€™s EIP process is democratic in form but not in function. While debates occur publicly, Vitalikâ€™s gravitational presence subtly steers outcomes.

Attack $ETH? You attack a man.

And exactly why Bitcoin outlasts empires.

Satoshi, by contrast, vanished... and that disappearance was Bitcoinâ€™s first smart contract.

By vanishing, Satoshi:

â€¢ Neutralized Founder Risk --> no single point of ideological failure.

â€¢ Institutionalized Code Supremacy --> upgrades require adversarial consensus (e.g., SegWit).

â€¢ Created Mythic Antifragility --> its â€œgodlessâ€ nature enhances Bitcoinâ€™s Lindy effect; the older it gets, the stronger it becomes.

â€¢ He championed a rollup-centric roadmap as Ethereumâ€™s scalable future.

â€œYou must be ready to burn yourself in your own flame; how could you rise anew if you have not first become ashes?â€

- That act split Christianity in two â€” Catholicism and Protestantism â€” and birthed a new, decentralized faith where no single voice ruled doctrine.

And code is structure.

tweets.content:
Wrote a guide on how to save BIG money on TRON USDT Transfers.

Most people think TRC20 transfers just cost one simple fee. Nope. Youâ€™re actually paying for two things: Bandwidth and Energy.

Hereâ€™s the breakdown on how it works and how to dodge a common energy rental scam:

So first, Bandwidth and Energy together make up what people commonly refer to as the gas fee on the TRON network.

Bandwidth:

- You get 600 free Bandwidth Points (BP) daily on TRON.

- Once you burn through those, each extra transaction costs about ~0.3 TRX in Bandwidth.

Energy (The Real Cost):

- Needed for executing smart contracts.

- If the recipient already has USDT, the transfer costs around ~14 TRX.

- If they donâ€™t have USDT, it jumps to ~27 TRX.

How to Avoid Wasting TRX on Energy: 

1. Stake TRX. Lock up TRX to generate free Energy.

- ~2,000+ TRX staked (one day) covers 1 transfer to USDT wallets.

- ~4,000+ TRX staked (one day) covers 1 transfer to new wallets.

- Rates fluctuate based on total staked amounts.

2. Use Third-Party Energy Rentalsâ€¦ and this is where things get interesting.

This is the â€œHackâ€ that saves you moneyâ€¦but could also scam and drain your USDT.

Some sneaky services let you rent Energy for dirt cheap.

- Instead of paying 14 TRX per transfer, they charge just 1 TRX.

- You send 1 TRX to a specific wallet, and it loads up your Energy.

- Some even swap your USDT to TRX anonymously.

BUT hereâ€™s where it gets dangerous.
This â€œEnergy rentalâ€ wallet is always sitting in your clipboard because you use it before every transfer.

Step 1: You go through the usual steps: send 1 TRX to rent Energy.

Step 2: You believe you copied your recipientâ€™s address for the USDT transfer.

But in reality, you never copied it properly. Maybe your phone lagged, maybe you tapped but didnâ€™t hold, maybe you got distracted.

You paste, hit send, and boom! Your USDT goes straight to the Energy providerâ€™s wallet.

THIS happens WAY MORE often than you think. People copy-paste on autopilot, donâ€™t double-check, and boom! Your money is gone.

These providers make OVER A MILLION USD per year JUST from careless users making THIS simple mistake.

Donâ€™t be one of them.
